comment.shortText:
Interface for EndpointAuthorization
Contains a schema and a string/string dictionary of auth data

tags.text: string string dictionary of auth data
auth scheme such as OAuth or username/password etc...

comment.shortText: Change working directory.

Checks whether a path exists.
If the path does not exist, the task will fail with an error message. Execution will halt.

comment.text: name only used in error message to identify the path

comment.shortText:
Returns path of a tool had the tool actually been invoked.  Resolves via paths.
If you check and the tool does not exist, the task will fail with an error message and halt execution.
Returns whether the copy was successful

comment.text: string -r, -f or -rf for recursive and force
optional. whether to continue on error

comment.shortText: Convenience factory to create a ToolRunner.

Exec a tool.  Convenience wrapper over ToolRunner to exec with args in one call.
Output will be streamed to the live console.
Returns promise with return code

comment.text: an arg string or array of args

comment.shortText:
Exec a tool synchronously.  Convenience wrapper over ToolRunner to execSync with args in one call.
Output will be *not* be streamed to the live console.  It will be returned after execution is complete.
Appropriate for short running tools
Returns IExecResult with output and return code

comment.text: an arg string or array of args

comment.shortText: Returns whether a path exists.

Checks whether a path inputs value was supplied by the user
File paths are relative with a picker, so an empty path is the root of the repo.
Useful if you need to condition work (like append an arg) if a value was supplied

comment.text: name of the path input to check

comment.shortText:
Find all files under a give path
Returns an array of full paths

Gets the value of an input and converts to a bool.  Convenience.
If required is true and the value is not set, the task will fail with an error.  Execution halts.

comment.text: name of the bool input to get
whether input is required.  optional, defaults to false

comment.shortText:
Gets the value of an input and splits the values by a delimiter (space, comma, etc...)
Useful for splitting an input with simple list of items like targets
IMPORTANT: Do not use for splitting additional args!  Instead use arg() - it will split and handle
If required is true and the value is not set, the task will fail with an error.  Execution halts.

comment.text: name of the input to get
whether input is required.  optional, defaults to false

comment.shortText:
Gets the authorization details for a service endpoint
If the authorization was not set and is not optional, the task will fail with an error message. Execution will halt.

Gets the url for a service endpoint
If the url was not set and is not optional, the task will fail with an error message. Execution will halt.

Gets the value of an input.  The value is also trimmed.
If required is true and the value is not set, the task will fail with an error.  Execution halts.

comment.text: name of the input to get
whether input is required.  optional, defaults to false

comment.shortText:
Gets the value of a path input
It will be quoted for you if it isn't already and contains spaces
If required is true and the value is not set, the task will fail with an error.  Execution halts.
If check is true and the path does not exist, the task will fail with an error.  Execution halts.

comment.text: name of the input to get
whether input is required.  optional, defaults to false
whether path is checked.  optional, defaults to false

comment.shortText: Gets a variables value which is defined on the build definition or set at runtime.

comment.text: name of the variable to get

comment.shortText: Gets the localized string from the json resource file.  Optionally formats with additional params.

comment.text: key of the resources string in the resource file
additional params for formatting the string

comment.shortText:
Make a directory.  Creates the full path with folders in between
Returns whether it was successful or not

Moves a path.
Returns whether the copy was successful

comment.text: optional. whether to continue on error

comment.shortText: Change working directory back to previously pushed directory
Change working directory and push it on the stack

Remove a path recursively with force
Returns whether it succeeds

comment.text: optional. whether to continue on error

comment.shortText:
Sets the location of the resources json.  This is typically the task.json file.
Call once at the beginning of the script before any calls to loc.

Sets the result of the task.
If the result is Failed (1), then execution will halt.

comment.text: TaskResult enum of Success or Failed.  If the result is Failed (1), then execution will halt.

comment.shortText: Sets a variables which will be available to subsequent tasks as well.

comment.text: name of the variable to set

comment.shortText:
Get's stat on a path.
Useful for checking whether a file or directory.  Also getting created, modified and accessed time.
see [fs.stat](https://nodejs.org/api/fs.html#fs_class_fs_stats)

Returns path of a tool had the tool actually been invoked.  Resolves via paths.
If you check and the tool does not exist, the task will fail with an error message and halt execution.

comment.text: whether to check if tool exists

comment.shortText:
Add arguments
Accepts a full string command line and a string array as well
Will handle double quoted args. E.g. '"arg one" two -z'

comment.text: string cmdline or array of strings

comment.shortText:
Add argument(s) if a condition is met
Wraps arg().  See arg for details

comment.text: string cmdline or array of strings

comment.shortText:
Exec a tool.
Output will be streamed to the live console.
Returns promise with return code

Exec a tool synchronously.
Output will be *not* be streamed to the live console.  It will be returned after execution is complete.
Appropriate for short running tools
Returns IExecResult with output and return code
Interface for exec options

tags.text: optional working directory.  defaults to current
optional envvar dictionary.  defaults to current processes env
optional.  whether to fail if output to stderr.  defaults to false
optional.  defaults to failing on non zero.  ignore will not fail leaving it up to the caller

comment.shortText: Interface for exec results returned from synchronous exec functions
